page.title: 03Main Waterway - Cowage Brook
page.content: {Cowage Brook}is the main waterway in our block.It starts at Clyffe Pypard and ends at the River Marden.It is 8.208 km long.It was naturally formed.There is not a lot of fish or plant life because of the{pollution from R.A.F. Lyneham.There is one main bridge across it at Goatacre on the A.3102.People who keep dumping rubbish in it are prosecuted by the{Wessex {Water Authority}who look after the brooks and rivers in Wiltshire.About {ten thousand gallons}of water run through it in an hour.The pump house is there to pump the sewage up the hill.In the brook near Clyffe Pypard there is chalk/greensand.After that it is mostly Kimmeridge Clay and Oxford Clay.Near Bremhill it crosses Corallion.Cowage Brook is a main river,and the resposibility of the {Wessex Water Authority,}from Goatacre.
